dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2279 IS: Protect Medicaid and Rural Hospitals Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Hawley introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To repeal the changes to Medicaid State provider tax authority and State directed payments made by the One Big Beautiful Bill Act and provide increased funding for the rural health transformation program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Medicaid and Rural Hospitals Act.

section.header: Repeal of changes to Medicaid State provider tax authority
section.text: Section 71115 of the Act titled An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of H. Con. Res. 14 (Public Law 119–21) is repealed and title XIX of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396 et seq.) shall be applied as if such section and the amendments made by such section had not been enacted.

section.header: Repeal of changes to Medicaid State directed payments

subsection.text: Section 71116 of the Act titled An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of H. Con. Res. 14 (Public Law 119–21) is repealed and the provisions of such section shall have no force and effect.
The amounts appropriated under section 71116(e) of the Act titled An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of H. Con. Res. 14 (Public Law 119–21) are hereby rescinded.

section.header: Increased funding for the rural health transformation program
section.text: Section 2105(h)(1)(A) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397ee(h)(1)(A)), as added by section 71401 of the Act titled An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of H. Con. Res. 14 (Public Law 119–21), is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iv), by striking and after the semicolon;
in clause (v), by striking the period and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following new clauses:
